indexPageTabTitle: Sebastian Schuler - Full-Stack Developer, UX Designer, Digital Marketing Specialist

hero.subtext: My passion lies in bringing forward great and human-centered products; whether that's through development, UX Design, or Online Marketing.

about.title: About
text: Hi there! My name is Sebastian and I enjoy creating applications as well as digital projects. My interest in development started back in 2012 when I signed up for my schools computer science class. As I found it very interesting, I decided to change to a more development focused school.

Since I've always been passionate about many different types of digital media, the Digital Media Marketing program was my first choice. Despite the name, the focus was on the three main categories: Computer Science, Marketing, and UX Design.
More details about me can be found in the next section <0>Experience</0>. You could also have a look at my <1>Work</1> straight away.
about.imageAlt: A picture of me hiking on the Grand Chamousset in France

hskl.institution: Hochschule Kaiserslautern - University of Applied Sciences
hskl.title: Digital Media Marketing
list: The objective of the course is the career-oriented education of computer scientists with basic skills in computer science, web development, marketing and digital content creation.
Acquired Skills include, but are not limited to, web development, Java desktop programming, SEO, CMS, online marketing, UX design, databases, and app development.
I completed numerous projects as part of my studies, many of which can be found in the next section.

ux.title: Certified Professional for Usability and UX - Foundation Level
ux.paragraph: The UXQB - CPUX-F certificate attests that I am familiar with the basic terms and concepts of usability and user experience, and that I'm able to apply them in the following areas of competence:

edv.title: Software Developer / Internship
list: I had to complete at least half a year of internship in order to get the apprenticeship recognized as part of my high school diploma (A-Level). I was able to learn a lot during my time here, as the company gave me the opportunity to work full time as a software developer.

Used technologies included Visual Basic, Java, Android, and SQL. My biggest project was the creation of an interface for the internal phone system that automatically displayed the status of employees and allows routing between departments.

bbs.title: A-Level / Assistant for Application Development
list: Here was my first 'professional' touch point with computer science and programming. The degree consists of two parts: A-Levels to study at universities, and an apprenticeship as an assistant for application development.
The topics were mainly Java programming, hardware and electrical engineering.
My final project was an Android app including a backend that could scan food barcodes and warn users, if any of their allergies were affected.

work.title: Featured Projects
work.titleDescription: Check out a selection of featured projects below. All my projects can also be found in my <0>Portfolio</0> or on my <1>GitHub</1> profile.
